document_data.name: Soubar
document_data.caption: ''Soubar within the Fields of the Dead.''
document_data.mainbody: '''Soubar''' ({{Pronounce|SOO|bar|refs=}}) was a small village on the [[Trade Way]], south of the [[Boareskyr Bridge]] and [[Forest of Wyrms]], north of [[Scornubel]]. It was often used as a way-station for traders traveling along that road.
document_data.Government: The population was highly variable, shrinking to an armed camp in the winter with the decline of caravan traffic. Soubar had no formal government, which led to a lawless culture full of brigands and ruffians.
document_data.History:
In the [[1352 DR|Year of the Dragon, 1352 DR]], there were rumors of a [[barbarian]] horde threatening Soubar. The [[paladin]] knight [[Priam Agrivar]] planned to journey to the settlement, but was interrupted.{{Cite comic/The Gathering|1}}

As of [[1489 DR]], priests of [[Bane]] were rebuilding the [[Black Abbey]] a former [[Baneite]] monastery. This had brought in much needed skilled workers, trade, and wealth. The project was unpopular with some locals, but they were advised to remember the [[Creed Resolute]], which discouraged religious discrimination.
document_data.Organization: The [[Purple Flame]] operated in Soubar in [[1358 DR]].
